intro: Meibomia grandiflora var. chandonnetii, commonly known as the Chandonnet's meibomia, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with opposite, elliptical leaves. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to white, with prominent yellow stamens, and bloom during the rainy season. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats within tropical forests.
